channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: A little bird told me this might be the job for you! Perl Developer in Canary Wharf
item.description: The client is an international company with a knack for making recruitment functions a breeze. Their reach is jaw-droppingâ€”over 80% of all UK job ads are posted through their serversâ€”and their prowess means that employers connect with top candidates in a fraction of the time. In other words, theyâ€™re ruling the roost in their industry, and they want you to join them!

item.title: Seeking Abominable Snowman (or Snowwoman) for Junior Perl Developer Role!
item.description: The role is located in Villars-sur-Ollon, Vaud, Switzerland. Sport enthusiasts may know this as one of the best outdoor playgrounds in the world. Spend winters skiing or snowboarding, and in the summer, hike or bike over those same slopes to cheese farms and wine cavesâ€”do I sense an alfresco picnic coming on?

item.title: The Step-by-Step Guide to Making your Friends Green with Envy
item.description: How many times have you been at a party and had to grin and bear it while your mates brag about their cool jobs? Robertâ€™s working from Antigua for the week, and Susanâ€™s taking yet another vacationâ€”how many days off can one woman have? Never fearâ€”weâ€™ve got the Step-by-Step Guide to Making your Friends Green with Envy.

item.title: A Fang-tastic Opportunity - Perl Developer in Manchester
item.description: Picture this: Dracula is on the hunt for a flatmate. He takes a gamble on some shady guy from Craigslist, name of Van Helsing . . . and next thing you know, poor olâ€™ Drac is staked while he sleeps. But wait! Thereâ€™s a better way, and thatâ€™s where you come in.

item.title: In Search of a Few Good Rock Stars
item.description: Make your mark on the world without leaving your desk! All of us dream of making our mark on the world, but how many people can say that their work reaches hundreds of thousands of people? Rock stars? Check. Celebrities? Check. Chonky puppy who just canâ€™t get down the stairs? Triple check. But what about the rest of us?

item.title: Perl 5 development has moved to Github
item.description: I didn't notice much public discussion, but in the last month, Perl 5 development has moved to Github.

item.title: #436 - Advent Calendar
item.description:
Hi there

As we entered the last month of year 2019, Advent Calendar became the hot topic in every tech talks. First in the list is the Perl Advent Calendar 2019. Similarly for Raku fans, there is Raku Advent Calendar. There is another Advent of Code for you as well. Are you into Cyber Security? If yes then you would love Advent of Cyber and win prizes as well. Andrew Shitov came up with an unique Advent Calendar where you will be introduced to a new language every day. Last but not the least, The Weekly Challenge team also joined the celebration with their first Advent Calendar of Challenges. You will get to revisit some of the most interesting solutions by the members of the team.

Are you into Games? Even if you are not Gamer please visit new player experience at Tau Station. It is a complex game but it is also completely FREE.

Enjoy the start of festive season and the weekly newsletter.
